titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1131: Theological miscellany

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of theological works from the 13th to 15th centuries, including several with unidentifiable authors: notably, a commentary on the De fide catholica, the new profession of faith from the Fourth Lateran Council; a work on virtues and vices; a collection of sermons or commentary based on the Gospels, and a Passion narrative. Also commentary on Peter Lombard's Sententiae, concerning God, evil, creation, sin, grace, incarnation, the Ten Commandments, and sacraments (among many other topics); three sermons by Jordan von Quedlinburg, two of which are identified by R. Lievens as numbers 317 and 260; a portion of a large collection of sermons by Jacobus de Voragine; excerpts from Robert Holkot's works on the book of Wisdom; a sermon given by Juan de Segovia at the Council of Basel; and excerpts on church law from Raymond of Peñafort. The pastedowns on the upper and lower covers are from mid-13th-century Aristotelian texts on the De animalibus.

msItem.title: Commentary on De fide catholica, f. 6r
Distinctiones magistri super quattuor libros sententiarum, f. 94r
De virtutibus et vitiis variis, f. 154r
Sermons and commentary on the Gospels, f. 189r
Sermo in consilio basiliensi de contemplatione, f. 302v

supportDesc.extent: 324 leaves : 310 x 213 (238 x 146) mm. bound to 320 x 215 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 324; [1-324]; modern pencil foliation upper right recto; unnumbered partial leaves between f.315 and f.316, and between f.317 and f.318; leaf with text written on it torn out between f. 165 and 166.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns, ruled in lead, ink, or drypoint.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in various Gothic book hands, hybrid, and secretary scripts.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials in red ink, ranging in size throughout codex from 2 to 11 lines; rubricated capitals and underlining; 6-line decorated initial in red, green and black ink (f. 94r).
Reused manuscript leaf pastedown, Inside front cover
Reused manuscript leaf pastedown, Inside back cover

binding.p: Red calf (stamped with a geometric pattern) over wooden boards; metal cornerpieces and brass bosses.

origin.p: Written in southern or western Germany around 1450.

history.provenance: Sold by Niels Hansen Christensen (Bloomfield, N.J.), 1963.
